text:
Is it possible to trigger a workflow from the API.
Something like trigger this workflow now.

Hey <@UJA612KEE> you can enroll contacts into a workflow with this API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/add_contact>  But if you are looking to take it live via the api, that’s something that still needs to be done in app
Thanks, that did it. It doesn’t show a popup yet, but the notification comes through

Hi Guys, we are experimenting with importing contacts into HubSpot via form submissions, the goal is to associate it with a landing page which is part of a campaign so that the contacts source is attributed to that campaign. We are submitting the form data along with hs_context set with the landing page name and url but it doesn’t get attributed to the campaign. I am assuming this is because it is just taking a URL and not an actual Page ID so its not really associating it with that page, its just linking to it from the contacts timeline. Is there any way around this? Is there a way to truly link a submission to a HubSpot page? Or any alternative ideas to resolve the problem would be gratefully received. Many thanks!

Similar issues (with the page not the campaign) were solved by sending the Page Id in with the form submission rather than just the URL.  It’s not supported or documented but it’s worked in the past so it may be worth a try

Neat, <@UFBNA9K9A>; I did not know this.

Can you clarify whether you’re describing a separate (undocumented) `pageId` parameter in addition to the `pageUri` and `pageName` parameters mentioned in our documentation? (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>)
yup, the `pageId` parameter exactly <@UDDJG2VFG>. I just copied what I saw from an embedded form after it rendered

hey there! I'm trying to restore a deleted template using API : <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/templates/post_templates_template_id_restore_deleted>

Here is my code in node.js and the error that I get.

I don't get why POST method isn't allowed. Can enyone help me figure it out?
FYI, <@UDU6KEBFB> Your API key is in the error message you posted, please edit the note or remove it as a precaution
<@UD5NW4PJ5> Yes! thank you! a PUT worked... Developer doc should be edited accordingly <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/templates/post_templates_template_id_restore_deleted>
